block.p: The Coca-Cola Company said yesterday that it signed a multiyear agreement with America Online Inc. to develop online and offline marketing programs. Terms of the agreement, the first worldwide Internet marketing initiative for Coca-Cola, were not disclosed.

The alliance, which had been expected, will focus on themes like music, movies, sports, holidays and community. Coca-Cola will pitch AOL through advertising, packaging and promotions, and AOL will promote Coca-Cola products online through its AOL, Compuserve and Netscape brands. The agreement comes after the principal Coca-Cola rival, the Pepsi-Cola Company unit of PepsiCo, signed a similar agreement with the Web portal Yahoo.

Also yesterday, Pepsi-Cola announced a multiyear renewal of its American supply and marketing agreement with Tricon Global Restaurants, owner of the KFC, Pizza Hut and Taco Bell fast-food chains. Terms were not disclosed. The chains were once owned by PepsiCo and sold Pepsi-Cola products.
